result.execSummary:
The defendant Edwin Ricky Maldonado Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 58 days time served.
Concurrent with: with Brown County case 06CF408

superMiscConds.notes: No violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause. No contact with anyone who has a prior drug conviction.
Pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Court ordered defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the surcharge - if not already done.  Pay costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.  DOC to collect those monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of funds.
Court advises defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edwin Ricky Maldonado Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (33 pages) commencing JUNE 11, 2014 received and filed.
denied because it is not in the public interest signed and filed. Copy sent to the defendant. sab
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. J.D. Watts, Br. 15, calendar successor, for review. mag

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the surcharge - if not already done
-  DOC to collect those monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant. COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 42 months with 58 days credit - concurrent with the Brown County case 06cf408 -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 18 months -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 24 months; pay costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution; 3) no contact with anyone who has a prior drug conviction; 4) seek and maintain employment.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.

Defendant Edwin Ricky Maldonado in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Defendant Edwin Ricky Maldonado in custody.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Attorney Stephen A Sargent in court, defendant Edwin Ricky Maldonado not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson for William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant not produced. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 44.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Original Transcript RELIMINARY HEARING  (14 pages) commencing APRIL 25, 2014 received and filed.

Attorney Stephen A Sargent in court, defendant Edwin Ricky Maldonado not in court, in custody.  Kevin R Shomin for William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Edwin Ricky Maldonado in custody and in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: MPD Officer Matthew Tracy.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Edwin Ricky Maldonado in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Defendant Edwin Ricky Maldonado in custody.  Dax C Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
